title: we are getting error while browsing
content:
when we browse the UI page of our application , in Firefox , it is not working. we are getting this error message "An error occurred: MOZILLA_PKIK_ERROR_SELF_SIGNED_CERT" . In Chrome and Edge browser is working fine.

For this application we are using self signed certificate. in other browser it is working fine , but when firebox it is not working. we have tried the below solutions. In Config : Security.enterprise_roots.enabled , we have changed the settings from “False to True”

Network.stricttransportsecurity.preloadlist , changed the value from “True to False”.

And we clear the SSL state and tried the UI page , got same error.

And also we tried

In profile folder renamed the cert9.db file to (cert9OLD.db) and tried that . But still we are getting same error message. We request your help on this.
creator: arockiarajesh

title: Playing video on Prime, HBo and Netflix is chopy
content: La reproducción del contenido es interrumpida cada momento por pequeños congelamientos de en la imagen. Siempre son muy rápidos pero es horrible ver cualquier película o serie así.
creator: silverwolf_333

title: YouTube blacks out entire screen while watching video.
content:
Hi, so yesterday, I updated to the latest version of FireFox (version 105.0). Nothing seemed to be out of the ordinary until I decided to watch a few YouTube videos. The best way I can describe this problem is that every time I decide to scroll down to see the description or read a few comments, the entire screen on my laptop goes black regardless if it's on default view or full screen.

Even though that does sound like a crash, the audio still plays, and if I power the computer to sleep mode and log back in, the window of the video automatically scrolls up and everything is back to the way it was (but I did had to restart the laptop once because it also visually broke my mouse pointer). The only way I can get around this problem is to pause whatever video I watch and then scroll down, and no black screen occurs.

I don't know if I'm the only one who has this problem, but I've never had this issue happen in past versions of FireFox. If there is another way to fix this problem, I'll be glad to take anyone's possible suggestions/solutions.
creator: dashoobi

title: Secure Connection Failed
content: PLEASE SOLVE THIS PROBLEM AS SOON AS POSSIBLE

title: Problem using Yahoo email starting yesterday
content: Beginning yesterday and now today I can surf web, click on things, etc. But when I pull up Yahoo email. It shows all my emails received but won't allow me to delete any. I can see them, click on them and read them, but can't delete any. HELP PLEASE I'm 69 years old and not tech savoy. This has never happened before
creator: sparker.1971

title: Zoom wrong in latest update 105.0
content:
Why does every update include loads of stuff that worked fine before but then gets broken?

BBC News webpage - always was fine - update 105.0 arrived - now has to be zoomed down to display correctly on a 12" Macbook. Default appears to be trying to display a mobile layout.

I don't want to have to adjust the zoom every time I look at it. And I don't want to set the zoom to 90% for everything.

Any suggestions for a cure? Thanks.
creator: aka_pseudonym

title: Firefox will not open websites after windows updates
content: Every time windows updates, Firefox will not open websites and gives Secure Connection Failed error, even website to download Firefox. Edge and Chrome open the websites fine. Last time I downloaded earlier manual install Firefox and it would open the websites fine, but it would not update when prompt came up saying update available. Windows just updated and most of the websites I need/use will not open in Firefox, even the federal government websites like USPS.com. It is getting to be too much hassle and I am considering to change main browser, even though I like Firefox (when working properly) better than the others. "Fixes" I found with internet searches do not work. Firefox was upgraded to 105.0 (64-bit), the latest version according to website. (Note: Had to download using Edge, Firefox gave Secure Connection Failed error when clicked on download button.)
creator: MajicEagle
